DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study is to compare telemedical antihypertensive treatment based on home blood pressure monitoring and conventional antihypertensive treatment based on monitoring of blood pressure in the doctor's office. We want to test the hypotheses that telemedical treatment is more effective in lowering blood pressure, provide better quality of life and is more cost-effective.
DOC.brief_title: A Comparison of Telemedical and Conventional Antihypertensive Treatment
DOC.criteria: age 20 80 years office blood pressure > 150/95 mmHg or systolic blood pressure >150 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure < 90 mmHg not able to perform home blood pressure measurements low compliance abuse of alcohol/ medicine unwillingness to participate
